Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CecropinXJ (natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: 94.59% similar toAP183 cecropin Bfrom the same species.Activity: Active against Gram-negative bacteria E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 1.43 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 1.97 uM), S. flexneri (MIC 3.21 uM), A. baumannii (MIC 1.43 uM), S. sonnei (MIC 2.89 uM), K. ozaenae (MIC 4.62 uM), and Gram-positive bacteria S. aureus (MIC 1.81 uM), D. ribution (MIC 2.48 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 5.76 uM). It also displayed anticancer activity (Xia L et al., 2014).Recombinant production:bacteria:Saccharomyces cerevisiae INVSc1 strain: expressed for 120 h,
Literature Information.Author: Li JY, Zhang FC, Ma ZH 2004
Literature Information.Reference: Acta Entomol. Sin. 47 (2004) 407â€“411. Refer also to Xia L et al. (2013),PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Prokaryotic expression of cecropin gene isolated from the silk worm Bombyx mori Xinjiang race and antibacterial activity of fusion cecropin
